questions.question_text: An engineer installed a new Nexus switch with the mgm0 interface in vrf management. Connectivity to the rest of the network needs to be tested from the guest shell of the NX-OS. Which command tests connectivity from the guest shell of the NX-OS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
There is no command upgrade -U in NX-OS guestshell.
[admin@guestshell ~]$ sudo upgrade -U
sudo: upgrade: command not found

[admin@guestshell ~]$ sudo rpm -Uhv
rpm: no packages given for install

https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1189

questions.question_text: An engineer must generate a checkpoint of the running configuration on a Cisco Nexus Switch. The checkpoint file name must be called `before_maintenance` and should be used for recovering the switch to its premaintenance state. The rollback of the checkpoint to running configuration should only occur if no errors occur. Which two configuration commands must be used to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
The question explicitly asks for a file to be generated and to rollback from file, so A and B are the correct answers.

Selected Answer: AB
There are two key requirements in the question:
1. Configuration rollback from a file -> B
2. Rollback will be performed only in there are NO ERRORS -> atomic rollback method must be used = A

Selected Answer: AB
Correct is A & B to create a checkpoint file and then use it for rollback

Selected Answer: AD
A. rollback running-config file before_maintenance atomic
D. checkpoint before_maintenance

Explanation:
D. checkpoint before_maintenance: This command creates a checkpoint named before_maintenance of the current running configuration. This allows the switch to save its state before any maintenance begins.

A. rollback running-config file before_maintenance atomic: This command rolls back to the checkpoint file before_maintenance in atomic mode, meaning that the rollback will only apply if no errors occur during the process, ensuring a successful and error-free rollback.

Selected Answer: CD
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/system_management/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide/sm_7rollback.html#task_742A244D6D954A37BE3DBA8E740D665E

Selected Answer: AB
A,B look correct.
shouldn't it be AD?

Selected Answer: CD
TULLY01# checkpoint ?
 <CR> 
 WORD Checkpoint name (Max Size 80)
 description Checkpoint description for the given checkpoint
 file Create configuration rollback checkpoint to file

TULLY01# checkpoint pepe ?
 <CR> 
 description Checkpoint description for the given checkpoint

TULLY01# checkpoint pepe description ?
 LINE Checkpoint description(can include spaces) (Max Size 80)

TULLY01# checkpoint pepe description tito

Selected Answer: AB
A and B

We need to give a file name for checkpoint hence we need "checkpoint file ..." Command.

We need "atomic" flag and execute rollback from a file to the running configuration, hence we need "rollback running-config file ... atomic" command.

The Answer A & B Seems correct 

 atomic—Implement a rollback only if no errors occur.
 best-effort—Implement a rollback and skip any errors.
 stop-at-first-failure—Implement a rollback that stops if an error occurs.

Selected Answer: CD
Configuration Example for Rollback
This example shows how to create a checkpoint file and then implements a best-effort rollback to a user checkpoint name:

checkpoint stable
rollback running-config checkpoint stable best-effort

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Firmware Upgrades through Auto Install
Auto Install enables you to upgrade a Cisco UCS domain to the firmware versions contained in a single package in the following two stages:

Install Infrastructure Firmware—Uses the Cisco UCS Infrastructure Software Bundle to upgrade the infrastructure components, such as the fabric interconnects, the I/O modules, and Cisco UCS Manager.
Install Server Firmware—Uses the Cisco UCS B-Series Blade Server Software Bundle to upgrade all blade servers in the Cisco UCS domain and/or the Cisco UCS C-Series Rack-Mount UCS-Managed Server Software Bundle to upgrade all rack servers.

Selected Answer: CD
I would vote for C and D here.

Install Server Firmware uses host firmware packages to upgrade all servers and their components in a Cisco
UCS domain. All servers whose service profiles include the selected host firmware packages are upgraded to
the firmware versions in the selected software bundles, as follows:
• Cisco UCS M-Series Server Software Bundle for all servers
CCC DDD

The Answer is C & D 
<< key word is Server Firmware >>

Selected Answer: CD
CD are the right answers.

Install Server Firmware—Uses the Cisco UCS B-Series Blade Server Software Bundle to upgrade all blade servers in the Cisco UCS domain and/or the Cisco UCS C-Series Rack-Mount UCS-Managed Server Software Bundle to upgrade all rack servers.


The rest of the choices here are installed with the Infrastructure Firmware instead.
CD are the right anwers
yup dont makes sense!

I think this question is completely wrong. Because installing server firmware stage upgrades different things. The fabric interconnects, I/O modules, and Cisco UCS Manager upgrade belongs to the infrastructure firmware upgrade.

questions.question_text: An engineer performs a Firmware Auto install upgrade through the Cisco UCS Manager. Which two Cisco UCS components are available to be upgraded in the install Server Firmware stage? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Execute a built-in role for the user and LDAP for the role-mapping for Active Directory.
choices.A: Execute a built-in role for the user and RADIUS for the role-mapping for Active Directory.
choices.C: Create a custom role for the user and LDAP for the role-mapping for Active Directory.
choices.D: Create a custom role for the user and RADIUS for the role-mapping for Active Directory.

discussion.content:
All users and user groups must be configured using Active Directory.
--> RADIUS cannot be used for authentication with AD, LDAP must be used for this purpose.

User1 must have full access to the Fabric Interconnect infrastructure and network security operations.
--> The built-in "Network Administrator" role can be used for this.

User1 must have full access to the storage operations configuration
--> The built-in "Storage Administrator" role can be used for this.

Therefore, answer B is correct.

Selected Answer: C
I agree w/ Annielover007 that built-in roles exist but one would need to assign *both* roles to User1. Answer B reads "a built-in role", singular. No *single* built-in role exists that grant the required access so going with C.

Selected Answer: C
C.

 Create a custom role for the user and LDAP for the role-mapping for Active Directory: Provides precise control over permissions, ensuring that User1 has full access to the required areas.

B. Execute a built-in role for the user and LDAP for the role-mapping for Active Directory: Provides general access but may not meet the specific detailed access requirements.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct!

questions.question_text:
An engineer must implement access control for Cisco UCS Manager. The configuration must meet these requirements:
✑ All users and user groups must be configured using Active Directory.
✑ User1 must have full access to the Fabric Interconnect infrastructure and network security operations.
✑ User1 must have full access to the storage operations configuration.
Which action must be performed on Cisco UCS to meet the requirements?
